definition: again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)

sentences.english: I remarried and now am with someone who loves me-- but what marriage doesn't hold problems of its own.
sentences.chinese: 我和一个爱我的人再婚了，但是婚姻仍然存在着问题。

sentences.english: But the reality is that dissolution rates are higher among cohabiting couples than remarried couples.
sentences.chinese: 现实是同居配偶的解散率高于再婚配偶。

sentences.english: The decline in marriage rates, ironically, makes it more possible to remarry after divorce.
sentences.chinese: 讽刺的是，结婚率的下降使再婚率上升了。

sentences.english: The couple had no children and Breuning never remarried.
sentences.chinese: 他们一生都没有孩子，布莱宁也没有再婚。

sentences.english: Remarriage for beauty or youth will lose some of its distinguishing force.
sentences.chinese: 为了年轻或美丽而再婚的独特吸引力也将会下降。

sentences.english: It is an important content for the construction of the harmonious society to construct the harmonious relation in the re-married family.
sentences.chinese: 构建和谐再婚家庭关系，是构建和谐社会的重要内容。

sentences.english: Another remarries, adding someone new to the equation.
sentences.chinese: 另外一个朋友再婚了，给我们之间的等式增加了新人。

sentences.english: What are we to conclude from the Old Testament's treatment of the subject of divorce and remarriage?
sentences.chinese: 我们从旧约对待离婚和再婚的问题上得出什么结论？

sentences.english: Because Du Gongjun's son longs for a mother, object Du Gongjun remarrying all the time.
sentences.chinese: 杜红军的儿子因为思念母亲，一直反对杜红军再婚。

sentences.english: What challenges do stepfamilies pose for children?
sentences.chinese: 再婚家庭会给你的孩子带来什么样的挑战呢？

sentences.english: Remarriages have been more likely than first marriages to fail for a number of reasons.
sentences.chinese: 由于一些原因，再婚比第一次婚姻更可能破裂。

sentences.english: Though Browning outlived his wife by twenty-eight years, he never remarried.
sentences.chinese: 虽然勃朗宁比妻子多活了28年，但他没有再婚。

sentences.english: Tom's family moved a lot and his parents re-married.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆的家人搬到了很多，他的父母再婚。

sentences.english: It’s not really the way you’re supposed to act here.” The upshot is that she feels her prospects of remarriage are dim.
sentences.chinese: 现实是，她感觉她再婚的前景黯淡无光。

sentences.english: This was the second marriage for the groom, who wanted to avoid inviting the same guests from the first wedding.
sentences.chinese: 这次是新郎再婚，他不想邀请头婚时的宾客。

sentences.english: After her divorce, Dunham married Indonesian student Lolo Soetoro, who was attending college in Hawaii.
sentences.chinese: 离婚后，邓汉与印尼留美学者苏托罗再婚。

definition: to marry for the second time/second marriage/second spouse
to get married and have kids/to start a family
